intro: Glochidion compressicaule, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
